adjective.description: (of a substance) easily evaporated at normal temperatures.
Liable to change rapidly and unpredictably, especially for the worse.
examples: the political situation was becoming more volatile

adjective.description: (of a computer's memory) retaining data only as long as there is a power supply connected.

origin: Middle English (in the sense creature that flies, also, as a collective, birds): from Old French volatil or Latin volatilis, from volare to fly.
